wikipedia_page.main: Prof Robert Douglas Lockhart FRSE LLD FSAS (1894–1987) was a 20th-century Scottish anatomist. He served as President of the Anatomical Society of Great Britain and Ireland 1955–57. He was also the official Curator of the Marischal Museum.

response: *Prof Robert Douglas Lockhart FRSE LLD (1894-1987) Professor of Anatomy at Aberdeen University.

In 1939 she took a sabbatical to work with Prof Robert Douglas Lockhart at the University of Aberdeen in Scotland. Due to introduction of war-time trans-Atlantic travel restrictions in the Second World War she unintentionally remained there until 1941.
